title: The Drug Abuse Handbook - Rovhal_Knullare
description:
** The Drug Abuse Handbook ** <a href="
http://books.google.com/books?id=MFbm2SRUUNsC&dq=The+drug+abuse+handbook&pg=PP1&ots=e52jbN4a6J&sig=URwhuLTA6VWNnUfLryloyqBCmgA&hl=en&sa=X&oi=book_result&resnum=1&ct=result#PPP1,M1" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://books.google.com/books?id=MFbm2SRUUNsC&dq=The+drug+abuse+handbook&pg=PP1&ots=e52jbN4a6J&sig=URwhuLTA6VWNnUfLryloyqBCmgA&hl=en&sa=X&oi=book_result&resnum=1&ct=result#PPP1,M1</a>
 <a href="
http://www.amazon.com/Drug-Abuse-Handbook-Steven-Karch/dp/0849326370" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.amazon.com/Drug-Abuse-Handbook-Steven-Karch/dp/0849326370</a>


This $141 book covers everything you need to know from drug prescriptions, drug abuse, drug testing, and drug laws.  If you're dealing with a DUI or a workplace drugtest, or maybe your parole officer or CCO is trying to catch you using, it's important to read this book.  If you're a jock and trying to use steroids, this book tells you all about human growth hormone (HGH) and it's uses and doses.  There are many other steroids discussed in this book.  

Here's a list of chapters:


1 Criminalistics?Introduction to Controlled Substances 

2 Pathology of Drug Abuse Edited by Charles V. Wetli
2.1 Preliminary Observations Charles V. Wetli
2.2 Diseases of the Heart
2.2.1 Techniques for Examination of the Heart
2.2.2 Myocardial Alterations in Drug Abusers
2.2.3 Endocarditis Michael D. Bell
2.2.4 Vascular Effects of Substance Abuse 
2.3 Lung Disease Michael D. Bell
2.4 Disorders of the Central Nervous System
2.5 Miscellaneous Complications

3 Pharmacokinetics: Drug Absorption, Distribution, and Elimination

4 Pharmacodynamics
4.1 Effects of Abused Drugs on Human Performance: Laboratory Assessment
4.2 Performance Measures of Behavioral Impairment in Applied Settings
4.3 Effects of Abused Drugs on Pupillary Size and the Light Reflex
4.4 Evaluating Abuse Liability: Methods and Predictive Value

5 Alcohol
5.1 Measuring Acute Alcohol Impairment
5.2 Measuring Blood-Alcohol Cencentration for Clinical and Forensic Purposes
5.3 Measuring Alcohol Postmortem
5.4 Biochemical Tests for Acute and Chronic Alcohol Ingestion

6 Neurochemistry of Drug Abuse
6.1 The Dopamine Transporter and Addiction
6.2 Neuropsychiatric Consequences of Chronic Cocaine Abuse
Deborah C. Mash
6.3 Neurochemical Adaptations and Cocaine Dependence Julie K. Staley
6.4 The Neurobiology of Relapse
6.5 Serotonergic Dysfunction During Cocaine Withdrawal: Implications for Cocaine-Induced Depression
6.6 Neurochemistry of Psychedelic Drugs

7 Addiction Medicine
7.1 The Principles of Addiction Medicine
7.2 Substitute Prescribing
7.2.1.6 Buprenorphine Maintenance Prescribing 
7.3 Treatment of Withdrawal Syndromes
7.4 Replacement Prescribing
7.4.1 Opiate Specific Prescribing
7.5 Management of Comorbidity
7.6 Toxicologic Issues

8 Medical Complications of Drug Abuse
8.1 Drug-Related Syndromes
8.2 Emergency Management of Drug Abuse-Related Disorders

9 Sports
9.1 Introduction
9.2 Specific Agents Rafael de la Torre
9.3 Anabolic Androgenic Steroids Don H. Catlin
9.4 Detection of Exogenous Anabolic Androgenic Steroids
9.5 Growth Hormone Abuse in Elite Athletes
9.6 Erythropoietin
9.7 Summary of International Olympic Committee Regulations 

10 Workplace Testing Edited
10.1 Development and Scope of Regulated Testing
10.2 Laboratory Accreditation Programs
10.2.1 An Overview of the Mandatory Guidelines for Federal Workplace Drug Testing Programs
10.2.2 The College of American Pathologists Voluntary Laboratory Accreditation Program
10.3 Analytical Considerations and Approaches for Drugs 10.4 Urine Specimen Suitability for Drug Testing
10.5 The Role of the Medical Review Officer: Current Issues 
10.6 Alternative Drugs, Specimens, and Approaches for Non-Regulated Drug Testing 
10.7 Implementation of Alcohol Testing: General Considerations and Processes 

11 Alternative Testing Matrices

12 Postmortem Toxicology
12.1 Introduction of Postmortem Toxicology
12.2 Specimen Selection, Collection, Preservation, and Security
12.3 Common Methods in Postmortem Toxicology
12.4 Strategies for Postmortem Toxicology Investigation 12.5 Quality Assurance in Postmortem Toxicology
12.6 Interpretation of Postmortem Drug Levels 

Drug Law
13.1 Current Legal Issues of Workplace Drug Testing 
13.2 DUI Defenses Alan Wayne Jones and Barry Logan
13.3 Fetal Rights Stephen M. Mohaupt

Appendices
Ia Glossary of Terms in Forensic Toxicology
Ib Common Abbreviations
Ic References for Methods of Drug Quantitative Analysis
II Sample Calculations 
III Predicted Normal Heart Weight (g) as a Function of Body Height
